<issue_comment>username_1: Yes, List is not supported, it will follow the logic of `converter`, and array should be used.
```java
@PostMapping(path = ""/uploadWithInfo"")
UserInfo uploadWithInfo(@FormPart(name = ""user"") UserInfo userInfo,
@FormPart(name = ""file"") MultipartFile file,
@FormPart(name = ""fileList"", required = false) MultipartFile[] fileList
) throws IOException {
return userInfo
change
```java
@FormPart(name = ""fileList"", required = false)List<MultipartFile> fileList
to
```java
@FormPart(name = ""fileList"", required = false) MultipartFile[] fileList

In the last 2 years, I have had the great pleasure to be part of the community building this amazing open-source tool. I am quite satisfied in feeling that I left a small dent in the overall experience for new users.

I was also very lucky to work on Canonical's distribution - which I leave in the great hands of @knkski  @DomFleischmann and more. 

If you want to stay in touch, please connect via [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rui-vasconcelos/).

I nominate @knkski to take on some of the responsibilities I held, in his own capacity, given his 3 years of dedication to Kubeflow.

With Gratitude,
Rui"", 'title': 'rm RFMVasconcelos', 'type': 'issue'}

username_0: Dear community,

In the last 2 years, I have had the great pleasure to be part of the community building this amazing open-source tool. I am quite satisfied in feeling that I left a small dent in the overall experience for new users.
Today I see my path take a different course, which I am excited to invest my full energy into. 🚀
I was also very lucky to work on Canonical's distribution - which I leave in the great hands of @knkski  @DomFleischmann and more.
If you want to stay in touch, please connect via [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rui-vasconcelos/).
I nominate @knkski to take on some of the responsibilities I held, in his own capacity, given his 3 years of dedication to Kubeflow.
With Gratitude,
Rui

Good luck!"

facebook/docusaurus,1028117616,5724,,"[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'sohamsshah', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2021-10-16T18:31:12Z', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': ""## 🐛 Bug Report

### Prerequisites

- [X] I'm using the latest version of Docusaurus.
- [X] I have tried the `npm run clear` or `yarn clear` command.
- [X] I have tried `rm -rf node_modules yarn.lock package-lock.json` and re-installing packages.
- [X] I have tried creating a repro with https://new.docusaurus.io
- [X] I have read the console error message carefully (if applicable)

### Description

The `img` tag in the NavbarLogo attribute in docusaurus.config.js file to add Logo to Navbar doesn't have any option/prop to set the `height` and `width` of the logo. Because of this, the Lighthouse Report fails and suggests to add `width` and `height` to the logo image.

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on issues](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-new-issues)?

Yes, I have Read it.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Run Lighthouse test on any docusaurus powered website
1. See the diagnostics message that suggests to add `width` and `height` attribute
1. Also in `inspect` element, width and height attributes are missing.

## Expected behavior

There should be props for this in order to add height and width to image along with defaults.

## Screen Shot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47717492/137598357-fc8cae8e-fe25-459f-9d41-f90225181ba2.png)

## Your environment
- Docusaurus version used: latest
- Environment name and version (e.g. Chrome 78.0.3904.108, Node.js 10.17.0): Chrome 87
- Operating system and version (e.g. Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS): Windows 10

I am new to the community and willing to contribute towards this issue. Please let me know more insights upon this. Would like to take this up!"", 'title': ""NavbarLogo doesn't have width and height attribute "", 'type': 'issue'}

{'action': 'created', 'author': 'Josh-Cena', 'comment_id': 945051281.0, 'datetime': '2021-10-17 05:12:55+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': ""As a further request: can we make all images within a Markdown file have the `height` (and `width`, maybe) attribute as well? Is it possible to fetch this data when we convert them to `require` calls?\n\nThis ensures that there's no layout shift as the images load."", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

{'action': 'closed', 'author': 'Josh-Cena', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2021-11-01 10:09:31+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}]","<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: NavbarLogo doesn't have width and height attribute
username_0: ## 🐛 Bug Report
### Prerequisites
- [X] I'm using the latest version of Docusaurus.
- [X] I have tried the `npm run clear` or `yarn clear` command.
- [X] I have tried `rm -rf node_modules yarn.lock package-lock.json` and re-installing packages.
- [X] I have tried creating a repro with https://new.docusaurus.io
- [X] I have read the console error message carefully (if applicable)
### Description

The `img` tag in the NavbarLogo attribute in docusaurus.config.js file to add Logo to Navbar doesn't have any option/prop to set the `height` and `width` of the logo. Because of this, the Lighthouse Report fails and suggests to add `width` and `height` to the logo image.
### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on issues](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-new-issues)?
Yes, I have Read it.
## Steps to reproduce
1. Run Lighthouse test on any docusaurus powered website
1. See the diagnostics message that suggests to add `width` and `height` attribute
1. Also in `inspect` element, width and height attributes are missing.
## Expected behavior
There should be props for this in order to add height and width to image along with defaults.
## Screen Shot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47717492/137598357-fc8cae8e-fe25-459f-9d41-f90225181ba2.png)
## Your environment
- Docusaurus version used: latest
- Environment name and version (e.g. Chrome 78.0.3904.108, Node.js 10.17.0): Chrome 87
- Operating system and version (e.g. Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS): Windows 10
I am new to the community and willing to contribute towards this issue. Please let me know more insights upon this. Would like to take this up!

<issue_comment>username_1: As a further request: can we make all images within a Markdown file have the `height` (and `width`, maybe) attribute as well? Is it possible to fetch this data when we convert them to `require` calls?
This ensures that there's no layout shift as the images load.<issue_closed>"

{'action': 'created', 'author': 'barkerd427', 'comment_id': 224642428.0, 'datetime': '2016-06-08 16:12:35+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': ""@username_4, not sure why it isn't asking, but the default is that it zooms to fit all markers. {'action': 'created', 'author': 'bridgetkromhout', 'comment_id': 230587561.0, 'datetime': '2016-07-05 20:06:48+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'Per the discussion in #82, closing this without merging. Thanks for helping us work through this, @username_0!', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]","<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Updated map zoom and labels

username_0: This closes #82 by adding support for localizing the map. I have currently set the zoom at 6, but we can play with that if it isn't optimal. If location information isn't available, then the default zoom is applied.

I also removed the labels and added info windows instead. They're still slightly buggy in that the ""disappear on drag"" functionality only works on the last window to appear. I've done this in the past, but it may require additional restructuring. I'll log an issue if this PR is merged.

<issue_comment>username_1: Thanks. I'll check it over more carefully tomorrow. Meanwhile, please put the Kansas-City-specific stuff into a different PR (per the request in the README - we don't want to mix ""stuff for a specific city"" with ""stuff that affects the whole site"" in the same PRs). Thanks!
<issue_comment>username_0: Updated.
<issue_comment>username_1: Commented in #82 where we can discuss the design. Thanks!
<issue_comment>username_2: I have built this branch to http://workstation.username_2.com if anyone wants to see what it looks like.
<issue_comment>username_2: just a note for those of you with merge powers - this PR requires a thumbs up from both @username_1 and @username_2 before merging.
<issue_comment>username_3: In general I like it. It looks less messy with the city names not shown.
What would make it even better though if the city names it now exposes are clickable links to the actual event (that wasn't working for me on Chrome 52).
My 2 cents.

<issue_comment>username_4: I like it, but similar to Bridget's comments on #82, I have a tendency to click ""No"" when sites ask for my location and it's unclear what providing that info will do (also for some reason, Chrome is not asking and simply showing the global, zoomed-out map).

I wonder if some sort of ""See events near you"" button that would trigger the location request and then zoom to an appropriate level (either a preset zoom number or encompassing the nearest X number of events near the geolocation).
<issue_comment>username_2: FYI, ""do not merge"" does not mean rejected, it's just a signal to other maintainers :)
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_3, that may be easy, but it's largely dependent on what information is available for that marker. Swapping in a link is easy if there's one available.

<issue_comment>username_0: @username_4, not sure why it isn't asking, but the default is that it zooms to fit all markers. It only changes if you select yes. You may have a global config switched that has turned off the location prompt. We can certainly add a separate button, but it would still prompt for access to the location information.
<issue_comment>username_1: Per the discussion in #82, closing this without merging. Thanks for helping us work through this, @username_0!"

JedWatson/sydjs-site,61202206,52,,"[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'cantuket', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2015-03-13 19:40:06+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': ""Hi guys,

I'm new to jade and was wondering if you had any advice for rendering jade templates on the fly with a simple ajax call. 

I've been looking around and see that you can do it both server-side or client-side and am wondering if you've already included these capabilities somewhere that I'm not seeing. Right now I've included all my partials/includes in my public folder in HTML, but i would like to move everything to jade and am having some difficulties.

Thanks for any help in advance!
~ Kyle"", 'title': 'Compile Jade templates for AJAX requests - Client vs Server-Side', 'type': 'issue'}

{'action': 'created', 'author': 'cantuket', 'comment_id': 80813147.0, 'datetime': '2015-03-15 02:42:59+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': ""It took a little bit of research and trial & error, but I came up with a system that I am truly ecstatic with. 

1) Im doing the Jade compiling client-side during development with [Grunt Jade](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt-contrib-jade) compiler, which compiles all of my Jade partials from 'templates > views > partials' to 'public > partials_compiled'. This may seem excessive, but the site I'm building currently has about 40 partials and will likely get up to +100 by the end of it. This allows me to access the pages as static HTML with AJAX right now, but if I want to create custom routes and manipulate data client side, while maintaining the asynchronous behavior of the HTML, then its extremely easy to do so because the file structure is identical in each 'partials directory'. I think this solution is also likely as good as a I can do performance wise, because the other options are...

a) client-side compiling, per AJAX transaction
b) server-side compiling, per AJAX transaction
c) mass server-side compiling to JSON objects at initial load, in some monstrous file

None of these options seemed very efficient, manageable or scalable in the long-term. this solution also allows my to minify all my HTML in production getting even more speed and easily move the code to other platforms in HTML for different non-Jade/Node projects. I'd still like to hear how other peoples opinions on the matter though.

2) To move all my previous HTML into Jade I used [html2jade] (https://github.com/donpark/html2jade), which I also run with grunt. I takes a little bit of clean-up after compiling to Jade, but is by far the best tool I found. Its also the only tool I found that allows you to designate nesting with 'Tabs' vs 'Spaces', which I think is a million times easier to read and maintain
column2: as well as other options like eliminating commas between attributes.\r\n\r\nI'm coming from building in Laravel with Blade, which is just as verbose as PHP, and the horrors of Wordpress for CMSs (I was moving to OctoberCMS before I left, but still doesn't even compare to the power and flexibility of Keystone). Even though the transition has taken some work and there's still a much smaller community/resources with Keystone & Node, I'm completely thrilled with everything about the transition. The entire development process is unbelievably smooth, no more VMs, dependency issues and massive DB migrations. Best of all my HTML has never been more beautiful and maintainable with Jade

column1: {'action': 'closed', 'author': 'cantuket', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2015-03-15 02:42:59+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}]","<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Compile Jade templates for AJAX requests - Client vs Server-Side
username_0: Hi guys,
I'm new to jade and was wondering if you had any advice for rendering jade templates on the fly with a simple ajax call.

I've been looking around and see that you can do it both server-side or client-side and am wondering if you've already included these capabilities somewhere that I'm not seeing. Right now I've included all my partials/includes in my public folder in HTML, but i would like to move everything to jade and am having some difficulties.
Thanks for any help in advance!
~ Kyle
<issue_comment>username_0: It took a little bit of research and trial & error, but I came up with a system that I am truly ecstatic with.

1) Im doing the Jade compiling client-side during development with [Grunt Jade](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt-contrib-jade) compiler, which compiles all of my Jade partials from 'templates > views > partials' to 'public > partials_compiled'. This may seem excessive, but the site I'm building currently has about 40 partials and will likely get up to +100 by the end of it. This allows me to access the pages as static HTML with AJAX right now, but if I want to create custom routes and manipulate data client side, while maintaining the asynchronous behavior of the HTML, then its extremely easy to do so because the file structure is identical in each 'partials directory'. I think this solution is also likely as good as a I can do performance wise, because the other options are...
a) client-side compiling, per AJAX transaction
b) server-side compiling, per AJAX transaction
c) mass server-side compiling to JSON objects at initial load, in some monstrous file

None of these options seemed very efficient, manageable or scalable in the long-term. this solution also allows my to minify all my HTML in production getting even more speed and easily move the code to other platforms in HTML for different non-Jade/Node projects. I'd still like to hear how other peoples opinions on the matter though.

2) To move all my previous HTML into Jade I used [html2jade] (https://github.com/donpark/html2jade), which I also run with grunt. I takes a little bit of clean-up after compiling to Jade, but is by far the best tool I found. Its also the only tool I found that allows you to designate nesting with 'Tabs' vs 'Spaces', which I think is a million times easier to read and maintain
column2: as well as other options like eliminating commas between attributes.

column1: I'm coming from building in Laravel with Blade, which is just as verbose as PHP, and the horrors of Wordpress for CMSs (I was moving to OctoberCMS before I left, but still doesn't even compare to the power and flexibility of Keystone). Even though the transition has taken some work and there's still a much smaller community/resources with Keystone & Node, I'm completely thrilled with everything about the transition. The entire development process is unbelievably smooth, no more VMs, dependency issues and massive DB migrations. Best of all my HTML has never been more beautiful and maintainable with Jade
column2: I literally stared at it for an hour last night.

column1: So thats my St. Pattys day induced rant. Thanks for the the great theme you guys have put together and to everyone supporting the Node community!
~ Kyle<issue_closed>"

sindresorhus/pageres,259856651,317,,"[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'b4dnewz', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2017-09-22 15:43:04+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': ""I would like to know if is possible to skip the requests that doesn't return a 200 status code and eventually count them (both success and non success).

I've seen in the documentation but seems not possible.

I see there is a 'warning' emit but no other events for when an snapshot is done correctly or not.

Many thanks in advance, I'm integrating this tool in a cli tool and is super powerful compared to otherones I've tried."", 'title': ""Don't capture non 200 status code responses"", 'type': 'issue'}

{'action': 'closed', 'author': 'b4dnewz', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-06-08 11:29:38+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}]","<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Don't capture non 200 status code responses
username_0: I would like to know if is possible to skip the requests that doesn't return a 200 status code and eventually count them (both success and non success).
I've seen in the documentation but seems not possible.
I see there is a 'warning' emit but no other events for when an snapshot is done correctly or not.
Many thanks in advance, I'm integrating this tool in a cli tool and is super powerful compared to otherones I've tried.<issue_closed>"

{'action': 'created', 'author': 'derberg', 'comment_id': 791387049.0, 'datetime': '2021-03-05 12:23:44+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_2', 'text': '@username_0 I think it all depends on the audience, like who is that for. Is it for the community? because the community asks specific questions, ""when we will have this or that"", ""when we plan to work on this issue"", ""when we will enable this"". For me roadmap is ""you know where you go, and these are the steps"". From vision, we clearly know where we are going and I love it. Just for me step = action, you take this step and then another, `User is able to focus only on business logic` is definitely not a step, especially after you explained it, you see that even I didn't get it and immediately thought it is just about model generation and that this one soon will be solved. For me, this is like an item on a more granular vision.

I hope you know what I mean, I'm basically doing a community guardian job here. ""Product"" must have vision and roadmap, but users need a list of action points, a pipeline of stuff, ordered, like ""this is for 2020"" (just few items) and ""this is for later"" (with clear annotation saying ""this is super dynamic, you want to push something faster, join us""). 

I just think that most people, when they ask for the roadmap, they ask for a list of things they want to do or can be affected by. 

Take for example HTML template and react component. If I would be outside the core team, I would be super interested to know in advance on what we plan to do there and when, so I can plan my stuff. `Deprecate html-template and improve asyncapi-react` is an item I would expect, one line that can clearly tell me if this is important for me or not.

Yes, I know roadmap != backlog, but they should be aligned (and best if combined in one view.

Now, when I look at 👇🏼 

![Screenshot 2021-03-05 at 13 18 08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6995927/110114627-4085df80-7db5-11eb-8b1d-a64628c951d1.png)

The black ones are the details people expect, backlog items that will be handled. And it is linked to the roadmap item, which is perfect. Just that this roadmap item is very generic, and something that can never be finished if it is not scoped.

Am I getting somewhere here? do you know what I mean?



btw, I forgot to mention that at the end it is as you planned, based on GitHub issues, so always, in the end, if something is not clear, a not shy community member can always click and comment on the issue ❤️', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

2. It's missing one step in the middle. Usually called ""Solution"" or ""Idea"". So, for instance, `User is able to focus only on business logic` will get 3 actionable items: a. CLI to create AsyncAPI files interactively

Just for me step = action, you take this step and then another, `User is able to focus only on business logic` is definitely not a step, especially after you explained it, you see that even I didn't get it and immediately thought it is just about model generation and that this one soon will be solved. For me, this is like an item on a more granular vision.

""Product"" must have vision and roadmap, but users need a list of action points, a pipeline of stuff, ordered, like ""this is for 2020"" (just few items) and ""this is for later"" (with clear annotation saying ""this is super dynamic, you want to push something faster, join us"").
I just think that most people, when they ask for the roadmap, they ask for a list of things they want to do or can be affected by.

Take for example HTML template and react component. If I would be outside the core team, I would be super interested to know in advance on what we plan to do there and when, so I can plan my stuff. `Deprecate html-template and improve asyncapi-react` is an item I would expect, one line that can clearly tell me if this is important for me or not.
Yes, I know roadmap != backlog, but they should be aligned (and best if combined in one view.

![Screenshot 2021-03-05 at 13 18 08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6995927/110114627-4085df80-7db5-11eb-8b1d-a64628c951d1.png)

2. It's missing one step in the middle. Usually called ""Solution"" or ""Idea"". So, for instance, `User is able to focus only on business logic` will get 3 actionable items: a. CLI to create AsyncAPI files interactively

files-community/Website,1105454770,112,,"[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'WhiteBrownie', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2022-01-17 07:05:06+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': ""### Description

As stated [here](https://github.com/files-community/Files/issues/7250#issuecomment-989881696_), a custom winget version isn't maintained any more. The website however still shows `winget install -e Files-Community.Files ` as a way to install Files. It should probably be changed to `winget install -e 9NGHP3DX8HDX`  (for the MS Store version) or be removed outright. 

### Steps To Reproduce

1. go on https://files.community/
2. click on the download dropdown
3. select  Winget (CLI)

### Expected behavior

The winget install command on the website should install Files

### Files Version

n/a

### Windows Version

n/a

### Relevant Assets/Logs

`winget install -e Files-Community.Files`
No package found matching input criteria.

`winget install 9NGHP3DX8HDX`
Found Files - File Manager for Windows [9NGHP3DX8HDX] Version Unknown
This package is provided through Microsoft Store. winget may need to acquire the package from Microsoft Store on behalf of the current user.
Version: Unknown
Publisher: Yair A
Publisher Url: https://files.community
Description: Files is a file manager with a powerful yet intuitive design. It has features like multiple tabs, panes, columns, shell extensions in the context menu and tags.

This is an open source project and community participation is welcome. To participate please visit https://github.com/files-community/Files
License: ms-windows-store://pdp/?ProductId=9NGHP3DX8HDX

Seizure Warning: https://aka.ms/microsoft-store-seizure-warning
Store License Terms: https://aka.ms/microsoft-store-license"", 'title': 'winget command on website', 'type': 'issue'}

{'action': 'closed', 'author': 'yaichenbaum', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2022-01-23 22:16:45+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}]","<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: winget command on website
username_0: ### Description

As stated [here](https://github.com/files-community/Files/issues/7250#issuecomment-989881696_), a custom winget version isn't maintained any more. The website however still shows `winget install -e Files-Community.Files ` as a way to install Files. It should probably be changed to `winget install -e 9NGHP3DX8HDX`  (for the MS Store version) or be removed outright.
### Steps To Reproduce
1. go on https://files.community/
2. click on the download dropdown
3. select  Winget (CLI)
### Expected behavior
The winget install command on the website should install Files

username_0: ## Request
We need a CSS file for our new Help Center powered by Help Scout
## URL(s)
https://help.techqueria.org
## Why did you make this request?
The default theme is pretty ugly, we need to use our branding
## Any additional context?
This needs to be...
https://techqueria.org/brand
https://docs.helpscout.com/ is good example
https://docs.helpscout.com/article/562-docs-branding-examples
![screencapture-help-techqueria-org-2020-08-17-20_49_44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4284691/90458021-32979800-e0cb-11ea-9da6-3ac5d059ff12.png)

![screencapture-secure-helpscout-net-settings-docs-site-5ebac665042863474d1a91ba-2020-08-17-20_49_28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4284691/90458022-33302e80-e0cb-11ea-8095-3efd9ab07de1.png)
<issue_comment>username_1: Hello! I would love to work on this issue!
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 Just assigned you!
<issue_comment>username_1: How exciting, thanks!

<issue_comment>username_1: Hello @username_0 ! I forked the repository and didn't find the help center page there, I later came back here and found the page is hosted in Help Scout. I went there for some guidance and found [this](https://docs.helpscout.com/article/835-css-styles-to-snag), but I'm not sure how to proceed, is the code somewhere I can see it or use it to test the CSS?
<issue_comment>username_2: Heyo, so the help center code is hosted on Help Scout but what you can do is grab the HTML and apply the CSS locally using the guide.
<issue_comment>username_1: Perfect! That sounds good, where can I get that HTML from? Where is that code located?
<issue_comment>username_2: https://help.techqueria.org/ has the current HTML
<issue_comment>username_2: [help-site.zip](https://github.com/techqueria/website/files/5380069/help-site.zip)
This is what I was working on
<issue_comment>username_1: Perfect, thanks!!"
